snippet: “Hateful” messages came after high school students were asked to copy the Islamic declaration of faith in Arabic calligraphy for a lesson on world religions.
abstract: Augusta County, Va, school district closes all schools due to angry backlash over assignment at Riverheads High School in Staunton in which students were asked to copy passage known as Shahad, declaration of faith in Islam; some parents accuse teacher of trying to convert children to Islam.

byline.original: By LIAM STACK and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

lead_paragraph: “Hateful” messages came after high school students were asked to copy the Islamic declaration of faith in Arabic calligraphy for a lesson on world religions.

headline.main: Lesson on Islam Shuts Down Virginia School District
headline.print_headline: High School Lesson on Islam Spawns Furor and Threats, Closing a District in Virginia
